text: hi everyone chastity Chad tan oh here
the Internet's busiest music nerd and it
is time for a review of the new Armand
Hammer record shrines this is a brand
new LP from experimental and abstract
hip hop duo a lucid and Billy woods for
the fourth time around as Armand Hammer
these two in my opinion continue to have
one of the most interesting dynamics in
hip-hop duo's today they are also fresh
off their most well-received record
today paraffin in 2018 which created a
rush of positive attention that I'm sure
led to the impressive feature list on
this record Earl Sweatshirt Kweli Kris
pink Sifu Moore mother wrapped Ferrara
but the fame seems not to have changed
Billy woods and lucid at least not in an
obvious way since on the fourth record
here Armand Hammer style is pretty well
established at this point left-field
instrumentals topped with a lucid
relentless flows grim cold-blooded
delivery and some abstract lyricism then
from there we have Billy woods who in my
view is one of the most underrated
rappers working today with his trademark
combo of shouting ranting and rapping
he's been responsible for some of the
darkest humor and soul-crushing
storytelling I've heard over the past
decade or so for the most part I knew
what I was getting into going into this
release but somehow Armand Hammer still
managed to squeak out their most in
direct project yet and I think a major
key to this change is in the production
this is not a tracklist of dour bangers
in the way the paraffin was the
instrumental palette this time around is
a lot dustier a lot Messier occasionally
spacey psychedelic eerie to the track
titled after legendary dub reggae
producer King Tubby is an intimate loop
of dramatic distant washy and dreamy
piano chords guitar pitched vocals
disorienting sound effects then there's
the very otherworldly pommel horse which
features all these layered space-age
tones backed by a chunky beat and an
intergalactic refrain from curly castro
when the moon and the planet and the
stars collapse collapse collapse then
there's leopards which features this
grimy and jagged combination of
stuttering bass and strung out guitar
then the
be on the track Charms sticks out as
well for sounding like a flip of some
South East Asian drum and flute jamming
or something I'm not sure either way I
love that the beat is equal parts tense
and tranquil I guess I should note
though that even with this being one of
the moodier releases in the Armand
Hammer canon
there isn't a whole ton of aesthetic
consistency among these instrumentals
every once in a while there is a beat
that does strike me as one-dimensional
in the same way that much of the
production on 2017 s Rome was like with
the very tight loop of gently wailing
reeds and primal drums on the track were
stories but generally speaking this
record is still a much more vibrant
listen with even some multifaceted songs
in the tracklist frita featuring quale
chris and fielded is a woozy warped
slow-motion piece of jazz rap with an
epic be switch in the last leg and
ramses ii also features another vocal
passage from field that just as we
transition into a smart closing verse
from a lucid life is anything but
statics supreme mathematics repeating
numbers cycles patterns summers winters
starting later ending faster babble
question chaos answered wave reflected
all direction which I suppose if you are
going to go a little lyrical miracle
with it you should also go numerical
still though generally the lyricism on
this project is great it is bleak it is
dark it is heady it is sharp it is
cynical just as most of arm and hammers
lyricism is just a sampling of some of
the many bars from mr. woods that stuck
out to me on this LP optimistic as a
prostitute's wishlist kids are alright
what he told the missus baby and the
reeds keep him from the Egyptians if she
never has a seed they're going to be
suspicious so in this one batch of bars
we already had that incredible dark
comedy mixed with this reflection on the
underbelly of society with all sorts of
religious lore the inter lines to the
track King Tubby stuck out to me as well
a lucid has some really killer lines on
the track - handsome gun a mnemonic
picture so you frame the logic your mind
the greatest weapon but your heart the
biggest target marksman I devour from
the lands of time forgotten power power
power on the minds of those without it
cowards and high places refute this
world is our
loving also his intricate poetics on the
track flavor flav where him and Billy go
back and forth conceptually with these
verses dealing in time and the
progression of such there is a lack
generally though of this kind of topical
or conceptual focus on this record from
track to track I mean there are
highlights like the Eucharist which
feature a lot of religious nods and also
parable where you do have that hook
parable of three three different verses
three different stories or personal
accounts coming from those verses having
said that though the respective writing
and rapping styles of Billy woods and a
lucid continue to be two of the most
unique out there today and both of them
are consistently writing forbidding bars
about one's struggle against a broken
world or a broken self and that is
really enough to make this a cohesive
listen never mind the interesting
narrative tie-ins with things like the
front cover over here and all manner of
different vocal snippets and transitions
from track to track or section to
section within a song the last point
I'll make is the features which you
usually don't get this many on an arm
and Hammer record they are a bit of a
mixed bag with pink sifu as well as Earl
Sweatshirt sounding so comatose in their
deliveries they suck the wind out of
these already low-key songs
there's also Kweli Chris to who
generally I'm a pretty big fan of and
even though his performance on this
thing is eccentric it's also pretty
syrupy and leaves a bit to be desired
that being said there are still great
performances here from rap Ferreira no
saj more mother who I think has the best
guest verse All Things Considered while
this may not be my favorite Armand
Hammer project I still think it's
another quality release from the duo and
easily one of the best abstract hip hop
offerings to come out this year feeling
a strong 7-2 la8 on this project
transition have you given this album a
listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should I review
next hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell is well over here next to my head
is another video that you can check out
hit that up or the link to subscribe to
the channel
Anthony Fantana Armand Hammer forever
